thread.title: Harrogate Town's Simon Ainge fires over bar from two yards with a chance that is harder to miss
thread.title_full: Harrogate Town's Simon Ainge fires over bar from two yards with a chance that is harder to miss

author: Jake Polden
title: Harrogate Town's Simon Ainge fires over bar from two yards with a chance that is harder to miss
text:
Sport Harrogate Town's Simon Ainge fires over bar from two yards with a chance that is harder to miss Simon Ainge did make up for his clanger with a great goal a little more than a minute later Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Harrogate player misses an absolute sitter - two yards out Share this video   Thank you for subscribing!   
He's not the first and he won't be the last, but that doesn't make it any easier to take. 
In the above video, National League North outfit Gloucester City take on Harrogate Town in a game that finished 1-1. 
With the match locked level at the break, players had to take a bit of a risk in the second half, and Simon Ainge decided to creep forward. 
And it paid off, after making his way towards the back post he was picked out with a driven cross and had an open goal in front of him. What can possibly go wrong? (Photo: YouTube/GCAFCOfficial) 
All that was left was for Ainge to pull the trigger and wheel away in delight. 
He managed the first bit, hitting the ball with power... and then watched as it flew out of the ground and entered the atmosphere. 
Now, Ainge could have taken the miss to heart and retreated into the safety of his own half, but a minute later he made up for his error with a great goal to put his team ahead. The last time the ball was ever seen (Photo: YouTube/GCAFCOfficial) 
Unfortunately his heroics weren't quite enough to secure the tie however, and Gloucester City pegged back Harrogate a whole minute later. 
Ah well, a day to forget and remember for Ainge, eh? Like us on Facebook
